text: Gonna miss yall
We'll miss you too <@U25PYL3Q8>! We'll record the sessions though and hopefully you can join us next year.
Slides
Seems to be an issue with the guest wifi network
Thanks, Jon. I'll give our team a heads up.
<@U22PU4G4A> pinned ’s File  to this channel.
Love the Mario theme :nerd_face:
Thanks for getting the PDF in the channel, Jon!
No prob!
HubSpot Web Dev Day Folks :arrow_right: Who's loving these new Developer Tool announcements? - Which are your favorite so far?
Whats been announced so far? Is there a page like there was for /new on HS?
New Design IDE, and Custom Modules. More to come soon as well :wink:
You are going to make us pick?!
Got any screens of the new design IDE?
Cloning modules AND 16 NEW fields to custom modules whaaaattttt!! :boom:
<@U22PKFRU5> You know it the custom modules!
:heart_eyes_cat:
screens / or presentations
files/folders
really... 16 new custom module fields is boss
holy crap the new custom module tool is amazing, so excited to use all 21 fields
i will never use a global group again
of course modules too

All I want to do is create amazing custom modules and re-use them everywhere (and/or sell them) - Quick question on sales of modules (for when it comes): Is there any HubSpot ToS regarding some sort of proprietary mechanism for enabling / disabling module functionality?
ex: some way to protect your module code from being purchased, reproduced, and re-sold under someone else's name / templates
drm
Fair point - but if it's not hard-wired into the software / application then it's what... EULA on your template download?

There will always be ways around it. Would be nice is HubSpot had a server that would handle a callback, similar to the way you can make that work with wordpress plugins... I'm not saying DRM is a bad thing.  Either way there are always ways around it!
So has anything been said about the possibility of supporting a user login system on HubSpot? (i know its a longshot but I'm hoping)
not yet
HubSpot could prevent purchased modules form being migrated like other template peices
I'm working on getting some slides posted in here... but much of it was in-app
I've seen work arounds using Social Sign-in. But nothing official launched

A few days ago, I wasn't able to clone a custom module. Some of these had 10 items. I ended up having to copypasta the code and add the elements. Didn't take me that long at all. I think to the average person that is enough of a setback, but I don't see it as prevention in the grand scheme of things.  

Just like gun laws, people find a way to get guns. IF they want to do this, then they will.

HubSpot could always do code compares with everything, but it isn't like code is patented.
Just devils advocate here. I think it would be nice to have some sort of protection. Just pointing out some items that I thought of....
no problem, I love it
is there a specific channel for dev day, or are you guys just using this?
thanks <@U7AS9142X>
no prob!
Do you have examples of this Luke? Or is it a service for social sign in they were using?

Hey everyone - I'm having a problem with access tokens and wonder if someone can give me a hand. I'm calling <https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/token> with my OAuth code - it's returning the tokens in the JSON, but It's not going to the success function in AJAX, but the error. It's giving me this error (though nothing seems to be wrong with the json): SyntaxError: JSON.parse: unexpected character at line 1 column 2 of the JSON data
can you paste the json data in here?
and your script?
sure, one sec
json data: {"refresh_token":"xxxxx","access_token":"xxxx","expires_in":21600}
script...
is it because you have carset isntead of charset
pretty sure it defaults to utf-8, so you can remove that
oh boy, good catch
didn't even see that
thanks very much
was the json data the var err
or err..error_des
no, actuall - the json data was what I posted above (with actual values, not the xxx, of course)
right
did thathelp you at all?
I knowevery time I get into oauth I cringe and hate it
My friends at <http://InboundLabs.co|InboundLabs.co> are working on it: <https://w.inboundlabs.co/booya>
<@U22PKFRU5> pinned a message to this channel.
this is awsome, thanks Luke! <@U38EZFVFE> see above
I agree <@U25PYL3Q8> that the copypasta-ing of someone else's code would deter most people
Here’s a link to my deck if anyone wants to take a look <http://bit.ly/2woUb4h|bit.ly/2woUb4h>
<@U38EZFVFE> this I think is the most sensible, because if they have to copy / paste and re-integrate files, references, libraries (potentially), etc... it becomes a real pain
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F7AV0LFUK/pasted_image_at_2017_09_29_11_47_am.png|lol>
thanks for sharing, good stuff in here
Yep… the new editor looks amazeballs!
chad are you here?
Nope I just got done looking at the slide deck. But I was able to see the designs for it 6 months ago as user testing for it.
They were just looking for feedback on it.
But i am excited. any word on when it will be available?
<@U25PYL3Q8> I just got back from lunch. When I tried it with the corrected charset it still came back with the same error
Oh god yes, I requested the ability to loop in custom modules years ago
are you able to share the actual page?
Hooray
it's just local, unfortunately
The rest of the function for calling it though, is like so...
have you ever used postman? I use that sometimes to get that stuff figured out
sorry, missed one line...
var redirect = "<https://HubSpot.local.aiag.org/index.html>";
you try surrouding your json with []
maybe another set of quotes or something?
unexpected character at line 1 column 2 of the JSON data
so it has to be first line, 2nd char
it's not json - it's just an object - the call is urlencoded so it just gets appended to the URL
ew
you try hardcoding it?
the json error, I believe is the json coming back, since I am not posting any json
I'm just throwing shit at the wall at this moment
oh
okay

that's the strange thing - when I look at the data payload that comes back, it looks correct - I get the access token and refresh token - the problem is my ajax function is throwing an error, so I'm not able to display the tokens on the page like I want it to
well, hacky, but to move forward can you modify the error to check for some things, then do the success
like.. make sure everythign you get back is right in an inf statement
then finish out what you need to do?
so, the error is happening when it hits the parseJSON function in the error section. So I commented that out and only had console.log(data) in the error section
and this is what it gives me: Retrying. Retry attempt 1 of 1. Reason: Server error
it's so strange, though, because when I look at the network tab in dev tools it shows me a response that is the correct data
hmm
ok, I tried it again, and this is the whole console response...

Cross-Origin Request Blocked: The Same Origin Policy disallows reading the remote resource at <https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/token?grant_type=authorization_code&client_id=xxxx&client_secret=xxxx&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2FHubSpot.local.aiag.org%2Findex.html&code=xxxx> (Reason: CORS header ‘Access-Control-Allow-Origin’ missing).
Object { readyState: 0, getResponseHeader: getResponseHeader(), getAllResponseHeaders: getAllResponseHeaders(), setRequestHeader: setRequestHeader(), overrideMimeType: overrideMimeType(), statusCode: statusCode(), abort: abort(), state: state(), always: always(), catch: catch(), … }
The first line is one error and the second one is the output of the console.log(data) in the error section of the ajax call
thats how I did my prefilter
my last ajax stuff i wrote
it seems like the page you are posting to is having a CORS problem
so you may need to edit that on teh server level
problem is that page is at HubSpot
though, I wonder - maybe it's on the return
I will check that
no, I have access-control-allow-origin set to * on my local box
something strange though - I am trying to do what this page says here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/oauth2/get-access-and-refresh-tokens>
The odd thing is that it's having me send the data in the URL, but the method is "POST" - but there isn't anything to post to it, since it's all in the URL
I have an entire setup with oauth somewhere. I'll see what I can find
thank you
I did my entire project in php
I think I tried doing it locally and I was having problems. That caused me to spin up a small server with https on it.
that wya I didn't have any problem with the https curl issue
<@U762JCP8Q> <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/do-HubSpot-apis-support-ajax-request>
Thats the problem I had there
I do have https set up on my local box - but I will check out this article
ok, this is odd. i've never seen an api that doesn't take ajax requests. I will have to look into what curl is. I don't know anything about it.
there are some other methods to use than curl for php, but that is the one i'm most familiar with
thanks for dev day today. My brain was fried after inbound, but I'm glad I came
